cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.category: Tropical Depression (forecast to become a hurricane by Tue)
cyclone.current_location: about 30 mi SSE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to meander near the Yucatan Channel today, then accelerate north-northeast across the eastern Gulf toward Florida’s Big Bend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near Cedar Key / Apalachee Bay)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No U.S. coastal watches at this time; only Yucatan Peninsula and western Cuba under watch/warning
weather_observation.warning_coast: No U.S. coastal warnings at this time; tropical-storm warning limited to Yucatan Peninsula and Pinar del Rio, Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Highest impact expected along Florida’s west coast from Tampa Bay northward through the Big Bend and later the southeast U.S. Atlantic coast
weather_observation.wind: Only a 5 % cumulative chance of tropical-storm-force winds; most likely outcome is breezy conditions (<39 mph).
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected at Mobile given west-of-track positioning.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands may bring 1–2 inches of rain late Tue–Wed.
weather_observation.other_hazards: None anticipated that would significantly disrupt port operations.
